abstract: As public comments on Comcast’s proposed merger close, local television broadcasters have been noticeably silent about the plans of the cable provider, known as a bruising competitor.
snippet: As public comments on Comcast’s proposed merger close, local television broadcasters have been noticeably silent about the plans of the cable provider, known as a bruising competitor.
lead_paragraph: Comcast, the nation’s biggest cable provider, has long played hardball with competitors and content providers. Now that it is seeking control of NBC Universal in a $30 billion transaction, those competitors are piping up, expressing fears that Comcast will use its consolidated power to favor its own content and squeeze out rivals.

headline.print_headline: Local Level Fears Power Of NBC Deal

abstract: Comcast, the biggest cable provider in the United States, has long played hardball with competitors and content providers. Now that it is seeking control of NBC Universal in a $30 billion transaction, those competitors are piping up, warning that Comcast will use its new power to favor its own content and squeeze out rivals.
snippet: Comcast, the biggest cable provider in the United States, has long played hardball with competitors and content providers. Now that it is seeking control of NBC Universal in a $30 billion transaction, those competitors are piping up, warning that ...
lead_paragraph: Comcast, the nation’s biggest cable provider, has long played hardball with competitors and content providers. Now that it is seeking control of NBC Universal in a $30 billion transaction, those competitors are piping up, expressing fears that Comcast will use its consolidated power to favor its own content and squeeze out rivals, Brian Stelter reports in The New York Times.

abstract: Bryan Lourd wants money, Buzz Lightyear has some and local stations negotiate with Comcast over its proposed merger in today’s media coverage.
snippet: Bryan Lourd wants money, Buzz Lightyear has some and local stations negotiate with Comcast over its proposed merger in today’s media coverage.
